intro: Pimelea cremnophila, commonly known as the silverleaf pimelea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a small shrub that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers during the autumn season, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a fine layer of whitish wax, giving it a distinctive silvery appearance. Pimelea cremnophila is adapted to withstand drought and poor soil conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
